catalog_info.title: Introduction to French Literature II: 19th and 20th Centuries: Tales of Identity
catalog_info.notes: Conducted in French; third hour devoted to discussion of texts studied.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: A 50- or 60-level course in French; a score above 780 on the SAT II test or the Harvard Placement test, equivalent preparation, or permission of course head.
catalog_info.description: How do we know ourselves? Traditional definitions of the self have been founded on family, gender, race, religion, nationality. We'll read a number of texts from the 19th-21st centuries that pose questions and complicate answers to questions of identity. Readings include works by Claire de Duras, Balzac, George Sand, Merimee, Colette, Nothomb, and LeClezio.
